name: chatgpt_gdc_600x600_2800_undersized
description: [ChatGPT] GDC 600x600 at 2800 mÂ³/h â†’ undersized (2000), suggest 900x600
query: I need a GDC carbon housing 600x600 for 2800 mÂ³/h airflow. Indoor warehouse ventilation.

turns.content: I need a GDC carbon housing 600x600 for 2800 mÂ³/h airflow. Indoor warehouse ventilation.

For the indoor warehouse ventilation project, you've selected a GDC carbon housing with dimensions 600x600mm and a required airflow of 2800 mÂ³/h. Since a single GDC-600x600 module has a maximum airflow of 2000 mÂ³/h, this configuration requires two modules in parallel to meet the airflow demand. The effective housing dimensions will be 1200x600mm.To finalize the configuration, I need to know the housing length required for your filter setup.Additionally, the requested 2800 airflow_m3h exceeds the recommended flow of 2000 for a single 600x600 module. 2 parallel units are required. Alternatively, a single 900x600 mm module can handle 3000 mÂ³/h.

clarification.why_needed: The housing length depends on the filter depth you plan to use. Knowing the housing length ensures the filter fits properly inside the housing.
clarification.question: Which housing length do you need?

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified that the requested airflow (2800 mÂ³/h) exceeds the capacity of the requested GDC 600x600 housing (2000 mÂ³/h). It provided accurate data from the catalog, suggested a valid larger standard size (900x600) that fits the requirements better, and correctly asked for the housing length, which is a required parameter for GDC units.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Verified GDC 600x600 capacity is 2000 mÂ³/h and GDC 900x600 is 3000 mÂ³/h against PDF page 14.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Addresses the sizing conflict, proposes specific alternatives, and asks for the missing length parameter.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly prevents undersizing the unit, which would lead to excessive pressure drop or filter bypass.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Excellent logic in offering the 900x600 alternative, which is a more efficient fit for 2800 mÂ³/h than doubling up to 1200x600.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the airflow limits specified in the catalog tables.

Correct identification of missing parameter (housing length)

content_segments.text: For the indoor warehouse ventilation project, you've selected a GDC carbon housing with dimensions 600x600mm and a required airflow of 2800 mÂ³/h. Since a single GDC-600x600 module has a maximum airflow of 2000 mÂ³/h, this configuration requires two modules in parallel to meet the airflow demand. The effective housing dimensions will be 1200x600mm.
To finalize the configuration, I need to know the housing length required for your filter setup.

Additionally, the requested 2800 airflow_m3h exceeds the recommended flow of 2000 for a single 600x600 module. 2 parallel units are required. Alternatively, a single 900x600 mm module can handle 3000 mÂ³/h.

turns.content: For your application, the GDC filter housing in size 600x600mm and housing length 750mm requires two parallel units to meet the specified airflow of 2800 mÂ³/h. The housing corrosion class is C2, suitable for indoor environments.Alternatively, a single GDB or GDMI module can handle the required airflow in a single unit.Tag item_1:

It also correctly requested the missing housing length parameter before finalizing the selection.

The alternative mention of GDB/GDMI is slightly misleading since those are bag/compact filter housings, not carbon patron housings.

dimension_explanations.safety: No warnings were provided about ensuring adequate pre-filtration upstream of the carbon housing in a warehouse environment (dust loading can foul carbon), and no mention of the importance of not exceeding recommended airflow per module for effective adsorption.

dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Product constraints are respected â€” FZ material for indoor C2 environment is appropriate, housing length 750mm is a valid option, and the system correctly flags the airflow limitation per module.
